revised_title: Electrogenic Sodium Pump in Mouse Liver Parenchymal Cells: Direct Evidence
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on isolated mouse liver segments to study the electrogentic properties of the sodium pump. They found that the sodium-potassium pump in liver cells is electrogenic, contributing to the membrane potential and playing a significant role in potassium uptake. The presence of Strophanthin-G, a sodium-potassium pump inhibitor, confirmed the electrogenic nature of the pump.
